article.headline: Dayton 62, St. Louis 54
article.story: ST. LOUIS (AP) -- Brian Roberts came off the bench to score 14 points and lead Dayton over St. Louis 62-54 Saturday. After Saint Louis took a 50-49 lead with 5:36 left, the Flyers (4-3) went on a 13-4 run to secure their third victory in a row. Monty Scott and Norman Plummer added 12 points each for Dayton. Reggie Bryant scored 16 points to lead Saint Louis (2-7), which lost for the fifth time in the last six games. Izik Ohanon added 12 points. The Dayton defense took charge down the stretch, holding Saint Louis scoreless for 4 minutes and 46 seconds before Luke Mayer hit a field goal with 50 seconds left. Dayton hit 21 of 52 shots, 43 percent, from the field.
